discover.instruction: Read about historical events. Notice the verb forms.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай об исторических событиях. Обрати внимание на формы глаголов.

content.text: The Eiffel Tower <highlight>was built</highlight> in 1889. It <highlight>was designed</highlight> by Gustave Eiffel. The tower <highlight>was constructed</highlight> for the World's Fair. Over 18,000 pieces of iron <highlight>were used</highlight>. The structure <highlight>was completed</highlight> in just two years. At first, it <highlight>was criticized</highlight> by many Parisians. But soon it <highlight>was loved</highlight> by everyone. The tower <highlight>was visited</highlight> by millions of people. It <highlight>was declared</highlight> a historical monument in 1964.
content.question: Are we talking about present or past events? What form do we use?
content.question_ru: Мы говорим о настоящих или прошлых событиях? Какую форму мы используем?

theory.title: Past Simple Passive
theory.title_ru: Прошедшее простое время в страдательном залоге

points.example: The letter was sent. The windows were broken.

points.rule: Use: Past events where action/result is focus
points.rule_ru: Использование: Прошлые события, где важно действие/результат

points.rule: Singular subjects → was; Plural subjects → were
points.rule_ru: Единственное число → was; Множественное число → were
points.example: The book was written. The books were written.
The project wasn't finished on time.
Was the Mona Lisa painted by Da Vinci?

notice.instruction: Find all past passive verbs. Identify who did the action if mentioned.
notice.instruction_ru: Найди все глаголы в прошедшем пассиве. Определи, кто выполнял действие, если указано.

tasks.text: The Titanic was built in Belfast, Ireland. It was launched in 1911 and was completed in 1912. The ship was considered unsinkable. Over 2,200 passengers were carried on its first voyage. Sadly, the ship was struck by an iceberg on April 14, 1912. Distress signals were sent, but help didn't arrive in time. The Titanic was sunk in less than three hours. About 1,500 people were killed. Only 710 passengers were rescued by the ship Carpathia. The disaster was reported around the world. New safety regulations were introduced after this tragedy.

notice.reflection_question: Why do we often use passive in news reports and historical accounts?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Почему мы часто используем пассив в новостях и исторических описаниях?

sentences.sentence: The pyramids ___ (build) thousands of years ago.
The meeting ___ (cancel) due to bad weather.
All the cookies ___ (eat) by the children.

sentences.passive: The telephone was invented by Alexander Bell.
Many buildings were damaged by the storm.

sentences.active: Millions of people watched the game.
sentences.passive: The game was watched by millions of people.

sentences.incorrect: The car was stole last night.
sentences.correct: The car was stolen last night.

sentences.incorrect: The Mona Lisa painted by Da Vinci.
sentences.correct: The Mona Lisa was painted by Da Vinci.

produce.instruction: Write about a historical event or how something was done in the past.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши об историческом событии или о том, как что-то делалось в прошлом.
prompts: Describe a famous building and when it was built
Write about an important invention and who it was invented by
Describe a historical event using passive voice
Write about something that happened to you using passive
produce.example: The Great Wall of China is one of the most amazing structures ever built. Construction was started over 2,000 years ago. The wall was built to protect China from invaders. Millions of workers were employed in its construction. Many people were killed during the building process. Stones, bricks, and earth were used as materials. The wall was extended by different emperors over the centuries. It was completed during the Ming Dynasty. Today, the Great Wall is visited by millions of tourists every year.

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with Past Simple Passive.

texts.title: The Moon Landing
texts.content: The first moon landing was achieved in 1969. The Apollo 11 mission was launched on July 16. Three astronauts were sent into space. The spacecraft was designed by NASA engineers. After four days, the moon was reached. Neil Armstrong was chosen to be the first to walk on the moon. His famous words were heard by millions. The American flag was planted on the surface. Samples were collected and were brought back to Earth.

texts.title: Crime Report
texts.content: A bank was robbed yesterday in the city center. The crime was committed at 3 PM. Three masked men were seen entering the building. The security guard was tied up. Customers were ordered to lie on the floor. The safe was opened and $500,000 was stolen. The robbers were driven away in a black van. The police were called immediately. Two suspects were arrested this morning. The money has not been found yet.

texts.title: Ancient Rome
texts.content: Rome was founded in 753 BC. According to legend, it was established by Romulus and Remus. The city was built on seven hills. Many great structures were constructed, including the Colosseum. Gladiator fights were held there. The Roman Empire was expanded across Europe. Many countries were conquered by Roman armies. Latin was spoken throughout the empire. Roads and aqueducts were built. Rome was eventually weakened by invasions and was sacked in 410 AD.

texts.title: My Childhood Home
texts.content: Our old house was sold last year. It was built by my grandfather in 1960. I was raised in that house. Many happy memories were created there. Birthday parties were celebrated in the garden. Christmas dinners were cooked in the kitchen. The walls were painted different colors over the years. Some rooms were renovated by my father. But eventually, it was decided to sell. I was saddened when the house was bought by strangers.

texts.title: The Discovery of Penicillin
texts.content: Penicillin was discovered by Alexander Fleming in 1928. It was found by accident! A petri dish was left uncovered in his lab. Mold was grown on the dish. Bacteria near the mold were killed. Fleming was intrigued by this observation. His discovery was published in a scientific journal. Later, penicillin was developed into a medicine by other scientists. It was first used during World War II. Many lives were saved by this miracle drug. Fleming was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1945.
